oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clarence Wilson, 1949
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee State University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Clarence Wilson Entered Tennessee A & I State College in 1945 on a Basketball Scholarship. Wilson Captained the Tigers From 1945-1949. During These Four Years, He Was Selected All-Mid-Western Conference Team. Under the Guidance of Coach Henry Kean, McClain, and Matthews, Wilson Developed His Set Shot, Which Later Became a Trademark in the Professional Ranks. He Graduated With a Degree in Health Physical Education in 1949. He Was Drafted by the World-Famous Harlem Globetrotters Basketball Team and Played All Over the World for the Next 15 Years.
